CatDescriptText: Harriett Newton, Ingram and Gerald Winkel, bus driver, Crafton Heights, were part of the Pittsburgher's Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 18, 1960 with question: "Do you think that economic status, race, or religion influences court decisions in civil and criminal cases?" Harriett Newton's answer reads: "I don't think juries stick to the facts all of the time.  I think sometimes they are influenced by other factors."  Gerald Winkel's answer reads: "No, I don't think these factors enter into verdicts."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Harriett Newton wearing eyeglasses, standing on Liberty Avenue across from the May Building, Downtown; Portrait of Gerald Winkel wearing light colored button down short sleeved shirt, standing on Liberty Avenue across from the May Building, Downtown
